title: 30 Best Architecture and Design Firms in Hong Kong
description: These architecture firms are leading the way in Hong Kong and beyond. The post 30 Best Architecture and Design Firms in Hong Kong appeared first on Journal.
author: Architizer Editors
excerpt: Updated rankings! With soaring skyscrapers, intricate interiors and world-class waterfronts, these architecture firms are leading the way in Hong Kong and beyond.
text: These annual rankings were last updated on July 11, 2025. Want to see your firm on next year’s list? Continue reading for more on how you can improve your studio’s ranking. Named the World City of Asia, Hong Kong is home to a diverse population that resides within a densely populated land mass. Covering a little over 250 acres (1,000 kilometers squared), this Special Administrative Region maintains one of the most impressive skylines that is backdropped by a beautiful mountain range. The region’s position as a global financial mega-hub has brought forth an influx of sophisticated skyscrapers, many of which have been built in the last two decades. Traces of Hong Kong’s British colonial period as well as pre-colonial structures, such as stilt houses and walled villages, are extant (although a substantial amount of its Cantonese architecture was lost during the Second World War). As the region expands with world-class infrastructure, questions surrounding heritage conservation persist. With a complicated colonial history, a strong economic agenda and a small landmass to work with, heritage conservation remains a hot topic of debate. What should remain and what can go? Nevertheless, architects in Hong Kong remain committed to a shared objective: designing for the future. With so many architecture firms to choose from, it’s challenging for clients to identify the industry leaders that will be an ideal fit for their project needs. Fortunately, Architizer is able to provide guidance on the top design firms in Hong Kong based on more than a decade of data and industry knowledge. How are these architecture firms ranked? The following ranking has been created according to key statistics that demonstrate each firm’s level of architectural excellence. The following metrics have been accumulated to establish each architecture firm’s ranking, in order of priority: The number of A+Awards won (2013 to 2025) The number of A+Awards finalists (2013 to 2025) The number of projects selected as “Project of the Day” (2009 to 2025) The number of projects selected as “Featured Project” (2009 to 2025) The number of projects uploaded to Architizer (2009 to 2025) Each of these metrics is explained in more detail at the foot of this article. This ranking list will be updated annually, taking into account new achievements of Hong Kong architecture firms throughout the year. Without further ado, here are the 30 best architecture firms in Hong Kong: 30. Ida&Billy Architects © Ida&Billy Architects Ida&Billy Architects is an architectural studio aimed at resolving problems and creating architectural interest out of simplicity and an integrated whole. We found that this is best done through caring attention to the requirements and characters of the programme, clients, users and sites to find out the individual projects’ meaning and potential. These meanings and potentials become a rich source of ideas, to be developed and experimented, to arrive at a genuine identity for each particular project. Some of Ida&Billy Architects’ most prominent projects include: TaiKoo Hui Sustainable Design Washroom, Guangzhou, China Bridged House, Kowloon, Hong Kong The following statistics helped Ida&Billy Architects achieve 30th place in the 30 Best Architecture Firms in Hong Kong: Featured Projects 2 Total Projects 2 29. Joey Ho Design © Joey Ho Design Limited Joey Ho Design was established in 2002 with a young and energetic team of talented individuals. The studio creates dynamic and engaging commercial and residential spaces. Driven by the pursuit of quality, the team is always concerned about the physical context of works and sensitive to the community, as well as mindful of the well-being of users. Some of Joey Ho Design’s most prominent projects include: Spring Learning Center, Hong Kong Arthouse, Hangzhou, China The following statistics helped Joey Ho Design achieve 29th place in the 30 Best Architecture Firms in Hong Kong: Featured Projects 2 Total Projects 2 28. AS Design Service © AS Design Service Limited AS Design founder & design director Sam Sum adheres to a philosophy that combines “Aesthetics and Style”, leading to visually stunning and thought-provoking. ​ With vast imagination, great market sense and determination to work together and achieve results with clients, AS Design has grown into a thriving design firms in Hong Kong. The strength of the design agency lies in images renovation for business and corporate, with an aim to assisting brands to stand out and become globally renowned, the international brands mainly in Hong Kong & Mainland China as well as South Pacific region, as well as commercial interior design of shopping mall, hospitality, retail, residential and office spaces. Some of AS Design Service’s most prominent projects include: Rice Home, Guangzhou, China Yoshinoya Fast Food Restaurant , Kowloon, Hong Kong UM Salon, Shenzhen, China UM Collezioni Female Top Fashion Multi- brand Store, Macau UM Top Fashion Men’s Underwear Brand Shop, Shenzhen, China The following statistics helped AS Design Service achieve 28th place in the 30 Best Architecture Firms in Hong Kong: Featured Projects 2 Total Projects 8 27. Sim-Plex Design Studio © Sim-Plex Design Studio Sim-Plex Design Studio is an innovative design studio which engaged in interior spatial design, mainly focus on expanding the possibilities of limited space. We are good at designing transformable space to create flexibility, multi-functionalities and artistic imagination, so as to response and improve the high dense environment in Hong Kong. We also engaged in architectural design and art installation projects. “Sim-Plex” is derived from ” searching complexity among simplicity.” We believed in every space could be expandable by searching complex spatial transformation among simple details of living. Some of Sim-Plex Design Studio’s most prominent projects include: Meditation Duplex, Hong Kong Therapy Tree Home, Hong Kong Nano Breeze, Hong Kong Floral Aged House, Hong Kong Floating Plateau , New Territories, Hong Kong The following statistics helped Sim-Plex Design Studio achieve 27th place in the 30 Best Architecture Firms in Hong Kong: Featured Projects 2 Total Projects 12 26. L2ds – LUMSDEN LEUNG design studio © L2ds - LUMSDEN LEUNG design studio L2ds Lumsden Leung design studio is and architecture, planning and interior design firm lead by Liz Leung and John Lumsden who have established a reputation of achieving excellent building and interior design solutions for over a decade. At the center of the firm’s design philosophy is the constant desire to discover the best possible solution for any given design challenge and client’s needs. Every project undertaken by L2ds is designed and directed personally by Ms. Leung and Mr. Lumsden who remain involved throughout the project’s creation. Our design solutions seek to create exciting buildings that are function, efficient and cost effective. Some of L2ds – LUMSDEN LEUNG design studio’s most prominent projects include: HKSH MRI Center, Hong Kong TVB Bus Hub, Hong Kong, Hong Kong Chongqing Bamboo Grove Masterplan, Chongqing, China TVB Premier Theater Complex Huawei research and development park, Nanjing, China The following statistics helped L2ds - LUMSDEN LEUNG design studio achieve 26th place in the 30 Best Architecture Firms in Hong Kong: Featured Projects 2 Total Projects 27 25. QUAD Studio © QUAD Studio QUAD Studio is a group of architects, designers and thinkers operating within the field of architecture, urbanism, interior, product and landscape design, research and development. Founded by Wai Tang, Charles Ho and Kelvin Chu in 2017 Sean Leung joined as Partner of QUAD Interiors and established QUAD Interiors in 2020, together they have over 50 years of architectural practice experience, with project footprints across continents. The studio aims to embrace a utopian freedom to help change the way people live in today’s contemporary society. The name QUAD studio stands for Quantum Urban Architectural Design and the studio emerges out of a team of creative individuals that truly believe that a well-designed environment evolves, adapts and changes the way people perceive a particular space, function or a neighborhood. Some of QUAD Studio’s most prominent projects include: Chengdu Smart Media City Xian Luxury Apartment C Future Office, Shenzhen, China Quadrivium, Shenzhen, China One Point One One, Hong Kong The following statistics helped QUAD Studio achieve 25th place in the 30 Best Architecture Firms in Hong Kong: Featured Projects 2 Total Projects 32 24. ELENA GALLI GIALLINI Ltd – Architecture and Design © ELENA GALLI GIALLINI Ltd - Architecture and Design Elena Galli Giallini founded her studio in Italy specializing in architectural design, renovation of old buildings, interior and industrial design. She relocated in Japan in 1995, where she developed collaborations, spanning almost 18 years, with renowned major Japanese enterprises, property developers and industrialists. This cross-culture professional experience enabled her to deepen the understanding of Asian culture and business approach, to enhance the ties between modern design and technical skills of Asian manufacturers, creating works marked by a synergistic fusion of craftsmanship value with up to date know how and achieving effective results in different industries of architecture, interior design and products. Some of ELENA GALLI GIALLINI – Architecture and Design’s most prominent projects include: Sino-Ocean Taikoo Li Chengdu, Chengdu, China Sino-Ocean Taikoo Li Chengdu, Chengdu, China GRAND GATEWAY 66 – NORTH BUILDING, Shanghai, China The following statistics helped ELENA GALLI GIALLINI Ltd - Architecture and Design achieve 24th place in the 30 Best Architecture Firms in Hong Kong: A+Awards Finalist 1 Featured Projects 1 Total Projects 3 23. Spawton Architecture © HEZHENHUAN Hong Kong-based Spawton Architecture was established in 2013 by British architect, Alex Jones, to provide exceptional design services in both the architecture and interior realms. Whether looking at new buildings or re-purposing and reusing existing structures, Spawton Architecture strives to provide high quality, contemporary design meeting both the clients’ brief and the end users’ needs. Spawton Architecture focuses on all aspects of a project from the initial space planning to the minutest detail to maximise the final finish and add value to the scheme. The studio is always open to collaboration with other architects and designers and as such, can undertake a wide variety of project typologies and scales. Some of Spawton Architecture’s most prominent projects include: Sino-Ocean Taikoo Li Chengdu, Chengdu, China Sino-Ocean Taikoo Li Chengdu, Chengdu, China Tribute Hotel, Kowloon, Hong Kong The following statistics helped Spawton Architecture achieve 23rd place in the 30 Best Architecture Firms in Hong Kong: A+Awards Finalist 1 Featured Projects 1 Total Projects 3 22. NC Design & Architecture © NC Design & Architecture Limited NC Design + Architecture (NCDA) is an architectural design studio specializing in residential, commercial and hospitality projects. We cover the full design remit encompassing interiors, bespoke furniture and innovative products, through to graphic design and the development of exclusive brand narratives. We’re interested in developing creative projects that reinvent the experience of space through meaningful connections. We focus on engaging through storytelling, developing new ways for people to interact with their world and each other. For us, storytelling is the art of inspiration. Our projects exist at the intersection of art and architecture and help start creative collaborations, stimulate interesting conversations, and deliver projects with their own visual identity that tell a unique story. At the heart of this is our hands-on research-based approach that brings an expressive consideration of details, integrating every element of the design process to elevate the ordinary in extraordinary new, refreshing ways. Some of NC Design & Architecture’s most prominent projects include: Timber House, Hong Kong Imperfect Residence, Hong Kong Stubbs Road, Hong Kong The following statistics helped NC Design & Architecture achieve 22nd place in the 30 Best Architecture Firms in Hong Kong: A+Awards Finalist 2 Featured Projects 2 Total Projects 3 21. arctitudesign © arctitudesign ARCTITUDESIGN approaches every projects with the imperative that the success of the project comes from a thorough understanding of the client, their operations and the needs of their people and their clients. We do not have specific style to limited our creativity. We believe living space should have warmth, cosiness and wellbeing atmosphere. We are inspired by the people we meet, and the relationships we keep. We approach each project knowing that each client is different and each culture unique. We provide space design service but also educate people what space is suitable and how to use it. We are inspired by Modernism, and believe that form/design has a function. Some of arctitudesign’s most prominent projects include: EF’s residence, Hong Kong MW’s RESIDENCE, Hong Kong FC’s RESIDENCE, Hong Kong Greenery Garden, Hong Kong, Hong Kong VM’s RESIDENCE, Hong Kong The following statistics helped arctitudesign achieve 21st place in the 30 Best Architecture Firms in Hong Kong: A+Awards Finalist 2 Featured Projects 2 Total Projects 8 20. O&O Studio © O&O Studio O&O STUDIO is a Hong Kong based award-winning design studio with an “Out and Outer” aspiration, providing architecture, interior, art installation, and furniture design services. ​Co-founded by Suzanne Li and Eric Chan in 2018, O&O believes that each design should be originated from a critical and cohesive process of strategic and visual thinking through to the end users’ evaluation, thus informing the next even more successful project. O&O does not serve standardised formula, but is recognised for nurturing influential design morphology that delivers fresh values to each commission. Eric and Suzanne has over 20 years of extensive experience across the industry. Some of O&O Studio’s most prominent projects include: Siu Kai Fong, Hong Kong Interstice, Hong Kong Meet’n Meal, Hong Kong MOONCRAFT, Shanghai, China Atelier Intimo Flagship, Shanghai, China The following statistics helped O&O Studio achieve 20th place in the 30 Best Architecture Firms in Hong Kong: A+Awards Finalist 1 Featured Projects 2 Total Projects 5 19. via. © via. Launched in 2009, via. is counted among Hong Kong’s most in-demand design studios. Within a ten-year span, via. has developed an impressive portfolio of retail, hospitality, commercial and residential projects. Led by founder Frank Leung, the client list includes leading developers, restaurant operators and hoteliers. The studio’s award-winning projects are defined by a logical, proportioned use of space, coupled with an appreciation for craftsmanship, creativity and comfort. Regardless of the project brief, each design reflects a refined sensibility, underscoring the relationship between simplicity and sophistication. Some of via.’s most prominent projects include: WWF Peter Scott Visitor Centre, New Territories, Hong Kong Yíshè at Atrium House, Hong Kong Ede, Hong Kong Bibliotheca at Novum West, Hong Kong La Maison Goutal, Hong Kong The following statistics helped via. achieve 19th place in the 30 Best Architecture Firms in Hong Kong: A+Awards Finalist 2 Featured Projects 2 Total Projects 17 18. Pulse On Partnership © Pulse On Partnership Limited Ajax Law and Virginia Lung established the Hong Kong-based interior design firm Pulse On Partnership in 2017. The design covers different interior scenarios such as cinemas, retail stores, clubs, sales centers and commercial offices. In the past 6 years, Pulse On’s projects have won many well-known international awards, including Red Dot Design Award (Germany), ICONIC AWARDS: Innovative Architecture (Germany), the American INTERIOR DESIGN Magazine Best of Year Awards, A&D China Design Award, Asia Pacific Interior Design Awards (HONG KONG), etc. As co-founders and design directors, Ajax Law and Virginia Lung initially defined the brand with a fashionable and trendy design sense, and experimented with different crossover design and production of clothing lines. Some of Pulse On Partnership’s most prominent projects include: Nanyang Wanyue Ciity Square & Landscape Sculpture, Nanyang, China SFC Shangying Cinema Luxe, Suzhou, China Bona International Cinema at Beijing Paradise Walk Mall, Beijing, China Bona International Cinema at Xian Joy City, Xi’An, China Shanghai One East – Palace Cinema, Shanghai, China The following statistics helped Pulse On Partnership achieve 18th place in the 30 Best Architecture Firms in Hong Kong: A+Awards Winner 1 Featured Projects 1 Total Projects 7 17. Millimeter Interior Design © Millimeter Interior Design Limited Millimeter Interior Design was established in 2007, specializing in professional residential and commercial interior design. Their primary focus lies in the quality of design, customer satisfaction and overall project management. After spatial planning, a functional analysis approach is adopted to achieve the very best results for our clients, well within time and budget. Some of Millimeter Interior Design’s most prominent projects include: House in Sai Kung, Hong Kong House in Hong Kong, Hong Kong Castello 4, Hong Kong House in Macau, Macau Villas Sorrento, Hong Kong The following statistics helped Millimeter Interior Design achieve 17th place in the 30 Best Architecture Firms in Hong Kong: A+Awards Winner 1 Featured Projects 1 Total Projects 10 16. Karv One Design © Karv One Design Karv One has offices in Hong Kong, Singapore, Guangzhou, Shenzhen, Nanjing, Chengdu and Wuhan. In recent years, it has focused on large-scale composite spaces, with more than 50,000 square feet designed area, which offers wonderful experience to over 40 million people every year. Through design, it is able to bring space closer to more people, and get them connected. And through the thoughtful creation of contexts, it turns the audience into participants and even co-creators of the design. In this way, it has managed to change people’s way of life more profoundly. Experienced in planning and designing complexes with multi-dimensional scenes. Karv One has successfully designed many innovative commercial spaces. Some of Karv One Design’s most prominent projects include: Chengdu Co-Innovation and Cooperation Center, Chengdu, China FLYING PAGE , Hebei, China BLOSSOM SCHOOL, Chengdu, China HYPERIÔN, Chongqing, China VISTA, Fuzhou, China The following statistics helped Karv One Design achieve 16th place in the 30 Best Architecture Firms in Hong Kong: A+Awards Winner 1 Featured Projects 2 Total Projects 8 15. Lim + Lu © Nirut Benjabanpot Lim and Lu is an award-winning inter-disciplinary interior design practice based in Hong Kong, initiated in New York City. Lim + Lu works internationally providing interior, branding, furniture and product design services. Lim + Lu’s designs, inspired by familiar images from everyday life, push the trend of individualization by presenting flexibility, practicality and a breath of fresh air in every project. Some of Lim + Lu’s most prominent projects include: Warehouse HM, Hong Kong Happy Valley Residence, Hong Kong The following statistics helped Lim + Lu achieve 15th place in the 30 Best Architecture Firms in Hong Kong: A+Awards Finalist 1 Featured Projects 2 Total Projects 2 14. TheeAe Architects © TheeAe Architects TheeAe Architects, an abbreviation of “The Evolved Architectural Eclectic,” embodies a profound commitment to contextual beauty, derived from the intricate tapestry of place, history, and culture. The studio’s philosophy is anchored in the belief that design should emerge organically from its surroundings, revealing the hidden or overlooked elements that bring architecture to life. By re-researching and re-defining these embedded layers, TheeAe Architects aspire to create spaces that transcend aesthetics, evolving from rational principles to unexpected discoveries that harmonize with nature. Some of TheeAe Architects’ most prominent projects include: The Artist House, Hong Kong, Hong Kong Flowered Arch, Kabul, Afghanistan Floral Solar Tree Gwang Ju City Main Library, Gwangju, South Korea MI Language School & Church (대구 국제교회), Nam-gu, Daegu, South Korea The following statistics helped TheeAe Architects achieve 14th place in the 30 Best Architecture Firms in Hong Kong: A+Awards Finalist 1 Featured Projects 2 Total Projects 29 13. AFFECT-T © AFFECT-T AFFECT-T is an abbreviation in closing: Affectionately. Often used by the artist Marcel Duchamp in his correspondence with friends and fellow artists. The studio uses the term as a guide to the relationship with the client and a central aim of built space and objects- to design and construct something which is viewed and experienced affectionately. Some of AFFECT-T’s most prominent projects include: Bamboo Micro-Housing, Hong Kong Asia Baroque Residence Children’s Fashion Atelier, Hong Kong Cavendish Heights Residence, Hong Kong The following statistics helped AFFECT-T achieve 13th place in the 30 Best Architecture Firms in Hong Kong: A+Awards Finalist 2 Featured Projects 2 Total Projects 4 12. OPENUU © OPENUU OPENUU is an award­-winning design research lab that focuses on space conversions and design collaborations. They design and create with an approach of playful pragmatism and are interested in creating supernormal moments by re-­searching and re­-arranging super normal, everyday notions. The studio creates to engage with people, and engages with people to create. openUU’s wide­-ranged clientele includes: Swire Properties Management, Osage Gallery & Art Foundation, Hong Kong Tourism Board and Hong Kong Arts Centre. Some of OPENUU’s most prominent projects include: platform(1×2), Hong Kong, Hong Kong Osage Open: Phase 1, Kowloon, Hong Kong modelScape, Zhuhai, China urbanUPLIFT, Hong Kong AL-wch, Hong Kong, Hong Kong The following statistics helped OPENUU achieve 12th place in the 30 Best Architecture Firms in Hong Kong: Featured Projects 3 Total Projects 9 11. Rocco Design Architects © Rocco Design Architects Limited Rocco Design Architects is a Hong Kong-based architectural firm dedicated to the uncompromising fundamentals of architecture and practice. Their works are guided by a persistent attention to the quality of the total environment, sensitivity to local culture and contexts, fulfilling users’ needs and clients’ expectations, as well as adherence to construction budget and programmatic controls. There are 170 staffs in Hong Kong and Shenzhen. They have demonstrated a prowess for design creativity over the years, with an impressive body of work across a wide range of sectors. Some of Rocco Design Architects’ most prominent projects include: Yunnan Museum , Kunming, China Guangdong Museum,  Wenzhou Shi, China Jiu Jian Tang, Shanghai, China LHT Tower, Hong Kong HKSAR Government Headquarters, Hong Kong The following statistics helped Rocco Design Architects achieve 11th place in the 30 Best Architecture Firms in Hong Kong: Featured Projects 4 Total Projects 9 10. School of Architecture, The Chinese University of Hong Kong © School of Architecture, The Chinese University of Hong Kong The School of Architecture at the Chinese University of Hong Kong is firmly committed to developing students’ core competency and critical thinking in order to achieve design creativity and leadership that enable lasting contributions to our built environment. The curriculum is structured not merely to train students to join the architectural profession, but to educate them in adapting to inevitable, future changes to be encountered during their careers. Some of School of Architecture, The Chinese University of Hong Kong’s most prominent projects include: ZCB Bamboo Pavilion, Hong Kong Project Plum Grove: In-situ, light touch and co-creative village revitalisation, Hong Kong CWLane Reading Space, Hong Kong Project Plum Grove II: Restoring Old House for Village Community in Mui Tsz Lam, New Territories, Hong Kong Folding Custom Bike: Coupling Galvanized Metal Craft and Utilitarian Tricycle as Urban Intervention, Hong Kong The following statistics helped School of Architecture, The Chinese University of Hong Kong achieve 10th place in the 30 Best Architecture Firms in Hong Kong: A+Awards Winner 2 A+Awards Finalist 1 Featured Projects 2 Total Projects 5 9. Orient Occident Atelier | OOA © Orient Occident Atelier | OOA Orient Occident Atelier | OOA | 東西建築 is an interdisciplinary architectural, interior and urban design studio. We focus on discovering, researching and utilizing the interdependence of “objects” and connections with surrounding space as design inspirations. Design themes of OOA encompass modern interpretations of Eastern and Western aesthetics while integrating nature and function. We believe the intrinsic local culture and technology found at the project site should be respected. Through natural and synthetic materials, we research and develop new methods of architectural detail assembly. OOA is committed to leveraging architectural design for the development of urban and rural villages with other professions on programs such as disaster prevention and relief. Some of Orient Occident Atelier | OOA’s most prominent projects include: Adventurous Global School, Krong Battambang, Cambodia WaterHall, Sneung, Cambodia Mount Pavilia Residence, Hong Kong The following statistics helped Orient Occident Atelier | OOA achieve 9th place in the 30 Best Architecture Firms in Hong Kong: A+Awards Winner 2 A+Awards Finalist 2 Featured Projects 3 Total Projects 3 8. LAAB Architects © LAAB Architects LAAB is a laboratory for Art and Architecture dedicated to spatial innovations that firmly rooted in environmental and cultural contexts. From public space and public art to architecture and interior, their collective of architects, designers, engineers, makers and sociologists work together with forward-thinking clients and collaborators to bring visionary ideas to life. Based in Hong Kong, our work has reached various global design communities, with recognition from Japan Good Design Award Best 100, German Red Dot and iF Awards, as well as American Institute of Architects International Region Awards. Some of LAAB Architects’ most prominent projects include: Harbour Home, Hong Kong Hong Kong Stock Exchange, Hong Kong f22 foto space, Hong Kong Hong Kong House, Japan Harbour Kiosk, Hong Kong The following statistics helped LAAB Architects achieve 8th place in the 30 Best Architecture Firms in Hong Kong: A+Awards Winner 3 A+Awards Finalist 2 Featured Projects 5 Total Projects 12 7. LWK + PARTNERS © LWK + PARTNERS LWK + PARTNERS is a leading architecture and design practice rooted in Hong Kong, with 1,100+ creative minds collaborating across a strong global network of 12 offices to deliver world-class solutions to the built environment. With over 35 years of growth, the diverse design team at LWK + PARTNERS shares expertise to provide a wide range of services including architecture, planning & urban design, interiors, landscape, heritage conservation, building information modelling (BIM), brand experience and lighting design. LWK + PARTNERS believes that great design has infinite possibilities and directs positive impact to people’s lives. The practice is a member of C Cheng Holdings (HKEX stock code: 1486). Some of LWK + PARTNERS’ most prominent projects include: Xiamen CIFI Bay Mansion, Xiamen, China Zijing Paradise Walk, Hangzhou, China Aoti Vanke Centre, China Chongqing Jiangshan Yun Chu – Legend Gallery, Chongqing, China Hebei Grand Hotel, Anyue, Hebei, China The following statistics helped LWK + PARTNERS achieve 7th place in the 30 Best Architecture Firms in Hong Kong: A+Awards Finalist 1 Featured Projects 9 Total Projects 30 6. PANORAMA Design Group © PANORAMA Design Group Established in 2003, PANORAMA Design Group has been famous for creating unique story-telling spatial experiences of large-scale composite interior spaces. With headquarter in Hong Kong and local offices in China, the company’s project categories cover Hotel, Property Development, F&B, Retail, Kids, Health & Wellness and received over 150 international design awards including 2016 IDA Design Award “Interior Design of the Year”, 2021 Red Dot Award “Best of the Best”, 2022 HKDA Global Design Awards “Hong Kong Best” & 2022 Architizer A+Awards “Best Interior Design Firm”. Projects have been featured in numerous international design magazines & journals. Inspired by the unique spatial characters of Hong Kong, PANORAMA’s design team adopts boundary-crossing strategy to produce new propositions and unique experience for different typologies of “multi-purpose/composite spaces” to respond to Asia’s rapid-changing lifestyles. Some of PANORAMA Design Group’s most prominent projects include: PlayPlus, Shenzhen, China Skytel, Chengdu, China KidsWinshare 2.0, Chengdu, China K11 MUSEA Donut Playhouse, Hong Kong Physical 2.0, Shanghai, China The following statistics helped PANORAMA Design Group achieve 6th place in the 30 Best Architecture Firms in Hong Kong: A+Awards Winner 1 Featured Projects 7 Total Projects 15 5. 10 Design © 张灏 SeilaoJiong Photography We are 10 Design, (part of Egis’ Architecture Line), a dynamic and innovative architecture and master planning practice. With over 400 architects and designers strategically located across three regional headquarters in London, Hong Kong and San Francisco, as well as six additional studios in key global markets. We design and deliver projects at all scales and complexities. Our diverse portfolio is a testament to our versatility and creativity, featuring a range of sectors, including mixed-use, retail, office, residential, hospitality, transport-oriented development, life sciences, education, civic and cultural. We’re committed to creating inspiring destinations that connect people to their surroundings, enhance the human experience, foster a sense of community and exceed expectations. We prioritize economic and social responsibility in all our multicultural projects, striving to create designs that are not only visually stunning but also environmentally sustainable and socially equitable. Some of 10 Design’s most prominent projects include: MixC Sungang, Shenzhen, China Jinwan Mall, Zhuhai, China Hon Thom Island, Phu Quoc, Vietnam CIFI Chengdu Wansheng TOD Project, Chengdu, China 10 Design Creates World’s Largest Indoor Ski Centre, Shenzhen, China The following statistics helped 10 Design achieve 5th place in the 30 Best Architecture Firms in Hong Kong: A+Awards Finalist 2 Featured Projects 9 Total Projects 93 4. One Plus Partnership © One Plus Partnership Limited Ajax Law and Virginia Lung established the Hong Kong-based interior design firm One Plus Partnership in 2004. The design covers different interior scenarios such as cinemas, restaurants, retail stores, clubs, sales centers and commercial offices. One Plus is good at spatial design driven by thematic concepts, and it makes a breakthrough and innovate each time during the design creation. Designers usually find a theme that fits with the project, then refine the expression of this theme, and finally make the visual experience appealing through artistic techniques. In the past 19 years, One Plus has been totally awarded over 800 international awards: In 2012, One Plus was the sole winner of Andrew Martin the International Interior Design Awards – the International Interior Designer of the Year Award, the first ever Asia design company who has won this honor. Some of One Plus Partnership’s most prominent projects include: Chongqing Mountain & City Sales Office CHANGSHA INSUN INTERNATIONAL CINEMA, Changsha, China WUHAN PANLONG PLAZA YINXING CINEMA, Wuhan, China Nanchang Insun International Cinema, Wuhan, China One Plus Partnership Office, Hong Kong The following statistics helped One Plus Partnership achieve 4th place in the 30 Best Architecture Firms in Hong Kong: A+Awards Finalist 4 Featured Projects 6 Total Projects 43 3. Architectural Services Department © Architectural Services Department The Architectural Services Department is a department of the Government of Hong Kong and is responsible for the design and construction of facilities throughout Hong Kong. The department’s three core functions are facility development, facility upkeep and monitoring and advisory services. Some of Architectural Services Department’s most prominent projects include: Lung Mei Beach Bathhouse, Tai Po District, New Territories, Hong Kong Beijing International Horticultural Exposition- Hong Kong Garden, Beijing, China Hoi Ha Visitor Centre, New Territories, Hong Kong Crematorium in Wo Hop Shek, Hong Kong Community Green Station, Hong Kong East, Hong Kong, Hong Kong The following statistics helped Architectural Services Department achieve 3rd place in the 30 Best Architecture Firms in Hong Kong: A+Awards Winner 4 A+Awards Finalist 5 Featured Projects 10 Total Projects 28 2. Bean Buro © Bean Buro The studio is an inter-disciplinary architectural design practice led by Lorène Faure and Kenny Kinugasa-Tsui, with a network of British and international collaborators to providing architecture, interior, installation, furniture and product design services. The diversity of the practice with its collaborators reinforces a core vision for the practice: to respond to the exchanges of global cultural narratives, incorporating overlapping design disciplines specializing in the social, economical and political production of urban spaces. We believe architecture is an emotional, spatial experience constructed by both the user and the author. Some of Bean Buro’s most prominent projects include: Boathouse Home Office, Hong Kong Abundant Thresholds, Hong Kong Tasty Flagship Restaurant Taikoo Li Chengdu, Chengdu, China Beau Cloud Mansion / The Cascade, Hong Kong Embrace Connect Purify, Hong Kong The following statistics helped Bean Buro achieve 2nd place in the 30 Best Architecture Firms in Hong Kong: A+Awards Finalist 1 Featured Projects 15 Total Projects 55 1. Ronald Lu & Partners © Ronald Lu & Partners Ronald Lu & Partners (RLP Asia) is an award-winning architecture practice focused on life-centric, future-ready design. Founded in 1976, RLP Asia is known throughout Asia as being a trailblazer in sustainable architecture. For more than 48 years, our deep roots in China and our international perspective have allowed us to build a global portfolio spanning green architecture, master planning, transit-oriented development, and interior design. Working in partnership with many of the world’s leading developers, government bodies and institutions, we bring the values of our clients to life in high-density urban environments to “Design Better Life” for the people and communities that use these spaces. Some of Ronald Lu & Partners’ most prominent projects include: Integral, Guilin, China SK Yee Healthy Life Centre, Hong Kong Integral Eco-Industrial Campus, Guilin, China Xiqu Centre, Kowloon, Hong Kong Harbour Kiosk, Hong Kong Top image: ONMANTIN, Kowloon, Hong Kong The following statistics helped Ronald Lu & Partners achieve 1st place in the 30 Best Architecture Firms in Hong Kong: A+Awards Winner 1 A+Awards Finalist 6 Featured Projects 14 Total Projects 184 Why Should I Trust Architizer’s Ranking? With more than 30,000 architecture firms and over 130,000 projects within its database, Architizer is proud to host the world’s largest online community of architects and building product manufacturers. Its celebrated A+Awards program is also the largest celebration of architecture and building products, with more than 400 jurors and hundreds of thousands of public votes helping to recognize the world’s best architecture each year. Architizer also powers firm directories for a number of AIA (American Institute of Architects) Chapters nationwide, including the official directory of architecture firms for AIA New York. An example of a project page on Architizer with Project Award Badges highlighted A Guide to Project Awards The blue “+” badge denotes that a project has won a prestigious A+Award as described above. Hovering over the badge reveals details of the award, including award category, year, and whether the project won the jury or popular choice award. The orange Project of the Day and yellow Featured Project badges are awarded by Architizer’s Editorial team, and are selected based on a number of factors. The following factors increase a project’s likelihood of being featured or awarded Project of the Day status: Project completed within the last 3 years A well written, concise project description of at least 3 paragraphs Architectural design with a high level of both functional and aesthetic value High quality, in focus photographs At least 8 photographs of both the interior and exterior of the building Inclusion of architectural drawings and renderings Inclusion of construction photographs There are 7 Projects of the Day each week and a further 31 Featured Projects. Each Project of the Day is published on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram Stories, while each Featured Project is published on Facebook. Each Project of the Day also features in Architizer’s Weekly Projects Newsletter and shared with 170,000 subscribers. We’re constantly look for the world’s best architects to join our community. If you would like to understand more about this ranking list and learn how your firm can achieve a presence on it, please don’t hesitate to reach out to us at editorial@architizer.com.
html:
These annual rankings were last updated on July 11, 2025. Want to see your firm on next year’s list? Continue reading for more on how you can improve your studio’s ranking.

Named the World City of Asia, Hong Kong is home to a diverse population that resides within a densely populated land mass. Covering a little over 250 acres (1,000 kilometers squared), this Special Administrative Region maintains one of the most impressive skylines that is backdropped by a beautiful mountain range.

The region’s position as a global financial mega-hub has brought forth an influx of sophisticated skyscrapers, many of which have been built in the last two decades. Traces of Hong Kong’s British colonial period as well as pre-colonial structures, such as stilt houses and walled villages, are extant (although a substantial amount of its Cantonese architecture was lost during the Second World War).

As the region expands with world-class infrastructure, questions surrounding heritage conservation persist. With a complicated colonial history, a strong economic agenda and a small landmass to work with, heritage conservation remains a hot topic of debate. What should remain and what can go? Nevertheless, architects in Hong Kong remain committed to a shared objective: designing for the future.

With so many architecture firms to choose from, it’s challenging for clients to identify the industry leaders that will be an ideal fit for their project needs. Fortunately, Architizer is able to provide guidance on the top design firms in Hong Kong based on more than a decade of data and industry knowledge.

How are these architecture firms ranked?

The following ranking has been created according to key statistics that demonstrate each firm’s level of architectural excellence. The following metrics have been accumulated to establish each architecture firm’s ranking, in order of priority:

  • The number of A+Awards won (2013 to 2025)
  • The number of A+Awards finalists (2013 to 2025)
  • The number of projects selected as “Project of the Day” (2009 to 2025)
  • The number of projects selected as “Featured Project” (2009 to 2025)
  • The number of projects uploaded to Architizer (2009 to 2025)

Each of these metrics is explained in more detail at the foot of this article. This ranking list will be updated annually, taking into account new achievements of Hong Kong architecture firms throughout the year.

Without further ado, here are the 30 best architecture firms in Hong Kong:

30. Ida&Billy Architects

© Ida&Billy Architects

Ida&Billy Architects is an architectural studio aimed at resolving problems and creating architectural interest out of simplicity and an integrated whole. We found that this is best done through caring attention to the requirements and characters of the programme, clients, users and sites to find out the individual projects’ meaning and potential. These meanings and potentials become a rich source of ideas, to be developed and experimented, to arrive at a genuine identity for each particular project.

Some of Ida&Billy Architects’ most prominent projects include:

  • TaiKoo Hui Sustainable Design Washroom, Guangzhou, China
  • Bridged House, Kowloon, Hong Kong

The following statistics helped Ida&Billy Architects achieve 30th place in the 30 Best Architecture Firms in Hong Kong:

Featured Projects 2
Total Projects 2

Joey Ho Design was established in 2002 with a young and energetic team of talented individuals. The studio creates dynamic and engaging commercial and residential spaces. Driven by the pursuit of quality, the team is always concerned about the physical context of works and sensitive to the community, as well as mindful of the well-being of users.

Some of Joey Ho Design’s most prominent projects include:

  • Spring Learning Center, Hong Kong

With vast imagination, great market sense and determination to work together and achieve results with clients, AS Design has grown into a thriving design firms in Hong Kong. The strength of the design agency lies in images renovation for business and corporate, with an aim to assisting brands to stand out and become globally renowned, the international brands mainly in Hong Kong & Mainland China as well as South Pacific region, as well as commercial interior design of shopping mall, hospitality, retail, residential and office spaces.

Some of AS Design Service’s most prominent projects include:

Sim-Plex Design Studio is an innovative design studio which engaged in interior spatial design, mainly focus on expanding the possibilities of limited space. We are good at designing transformable space to create flexibility, multi-functionalities and artistic imagination, so as to response and improve the high dense environment in Hong Kong.

We also engaged in architectural design and art installation projects. “Sim-Plex” is derived from ” searching complexity among simplicity.” We believed in every space could be expandable by searching complex spatial transformation among simple details of living.

L2ds Lumsden Leung design studio is and architecture, planning and interior design firm lead by Liz Leung and John Lumsden who have established a reputation of achieving excellent building and interior design solutions for over a decade. At the center of the firm’s design philosophy is the constant desire to discover the best possible solution for any given design challenge and client’s needs.

Every project undertaken by L2ds is designed and directed personally by Ms. Leung and Mr. Lumsden who remain involved throughout the project’s creation. Our design solutions seek to create exciting buildings that are function, efficient and cost effective.

QUAD Studio is a group of architects, designers and thinkers operating within the field of architecture, urbanism, interior, product and landscape design, research and development. Founded by Wai Tang, Charles Ho and Kelvin Chu in 2017 Sean Leung joined as Partner of QUAD Interiors and established QUAD Interiors in 2020, together they have over 50 years of architectural practice experience, with project footprints across continents. The studio aims to embrace a utopian freedom to help change the way people live in today’s contemporary society.

The name QUAD studio stands for Quantum Urban Architectural Design and the studio emerges out of a team of creative individuals that truly believe that a well-designed environment evolves, adapts and changes the way people perceive a particular space, function or a neighborhood.

Some of QUAD Studio’s most prominent projects include:

Elena Galli Giallini founded her studio in Italy specializing in architectural design, renovation of old buildings, interior and industrial design. She relocated in Japan in 1995, where she developed collaborations, spanning almost 18 years, with renowned major Japanese enterprises, property developers and industrialists.

This cross-culture professional experience enabled her to deepen the understanding of Asian culture and business approach, to enhance the ties between modern design and technical skills of Asian manufacturers, creating works marked by a synergistic fusion of craftsmanship value with up to date know how and achieving effective results in different industries of architecture, interior design and products.

Hong Kong-based Spawton Architecture was established in 2013 by British architect, Alex Jones, to provide exceptional design services in both the architecture and interior realms. Spawton Architecture focuses on all aspects of a project from the initial space planning to the minutest detail to maximise the final finish and add value to the scheme. © NC Design & Architecture Limited

NC Design + Architecture (NCDA) is an architectural design studio specializing in residential, commercial and hospitality projects. We cover the full design remit encompassing interiors, bespoke furniture and innovative products, through to graphic design and the development of exclusive brand narratives. We’re interested in developing creative projects that reinvent the experience of space through meaningful connections. We focus on engaging through storytelling, developing new ways for people to interact with their world and each other.

For us, storytelling is the art of inspiration. Our projects exist at the intersection of art and architecture and help start creative collaborations, stimulate interesting conversations, and deliver projects with their own visual identity that tell a unique story. We are inspired by the people we meet, and the relationships we keep. We approach each project knowing that each client is different and each culture unique. Through natural and synthetic materials, we research and develop new methods of architectural detail assembly.

LWK + PARTNERS is a leading architecture and design practice rooted in Hong Kong, with 1,100+ creative minds collaborating across a strong global network of 12 offices to deliver world-class solutions to the built environment. With over 35 years of growth, the diverse design team at LWK + PARTNERS shares expertise to provide a wide range of services including architecture, planning & urban design, interiors, landscape, heritage conservation, building information modelling (BIM), brand experience and lighting design. © PANORAMA Design Group

Established in 2003, PANORAMA Design Group has been famous for creating unique story-telling spatial experiences of large-scale composite interior spaces. With headquarter in Hong Kong and local offices in China, the company’s project categories cover Hotel, Property Development, F&B, Retail, Kids, Health & Wellness and received over 150 international design awards including 2016 IDA Design Award “Interior Design of the Year”, 2021 Red Dot Award “Best of the Best”, 2022 HKDA Global Design Awards “Hong Kong Best” & 2022 Architizer A+Awards “Best Interior Design Firm”. We design and deliver projects at all scales and complexities. © One Plus Partnership Limited

Ajax Law and Virginia Lung established the Hong Kong-based interior design firm One Plus Partnership in 2004. The design covers different interior scenarios such as cinemas, restaurants, retail stores, clubs, sales centers and commercial offices.

One Plus is good at spatial design driven by thematic concepts, and it makes a breakthrough and innovate each time during the design creation. Designers usually find a theme that fits with the project, then refine the expression of this theme, and finally make the visual experience appealing through artistic techniques.

In the past 19 years, One Plus has been totally awarded over 800 international awards: In 2012, One Plus was the sole winner of Andrew Martin the International Interior Design Awards – the International Interior Designer of the Year Award, the first ever Asia design company who has won this honor.

3. Architectural Services Department

© Architectural Services Department

The Architectural Services Department is a department of the Government of Hong Kong and is responsible for the design and construction of facilities throughout Hong Kong. The department’s three core functions are facility development, facility upkeep and monitoring and advisory services.

Some of Architectural Services Department’s most prominent projects include:

2. Bean Buro

© Bean Buro

The studio is an inter-disciplinary architectural design practice led by Lorène Faure and Kenny Kinugasa-Tsui, with a network of British and international collaborators to providing architecture, interior, installation, furniture and product design services.

The diversity of the practice with its collaborators reinforces a core vision for the practice: to respond to the exchanges of global cultural narratives, incorporating overlapping design disciplines specializing in the social, economical and political production of urban spaces.

We believe architecture is an emotional, spatial experience constructed by both the user and the author.

Some of Bean Buro’s most prominent projects include:

  • Boathouse Home Office, Hong Kong
  • Abundant Thresholds, Hong Kong
  • Tasty Flagship Restaurant Taikoo Li Chengdu, Chengdu, China
  • Beau Cloud Mansion / The Cascade, Hong Kong

1. Ronald Lu & Partners

© Ronald Lu & Partners

Ronald Lu & Partners (RLP Asia) is an award-winning architecture practice focused on life-centric, future-ready design. Founded in 1976, RLP Asia is known throughout Asia as being a trailblazer in sustainable architecture. For more than 48 years, our deep roots in China and our international perspective have allowed us to build a global portfolio spanning green architecture, master planning, transit-oriented development, and interior design. Working in partnership with many of the world’s leading developers, government bodies and institutions, we bring the values of our clients to life in high-density urban environments to “Design Better Life” for the people and communities that use these spaces.

Some of Ronald Lu & Partners’ most prominent projects include:

  • Integral, Guilin, China
  • SK Yee Healthy Life Centre, Hong Kong
  • Integral Eco-Industrial Campus, Guilin, China
  • Xiqu Centre, Kowloon, Hong Kong
  • Harbour Kiosk, Hong Kong

Why Should I Trust Architizer’s Ranking?

With more than 30,000 architecture firms and over 130,000 projects within its database, Architizer is proud to host the world’s largest online community of architects and building product manufacturers. Its celebrated A+Awards program is also the largest celebration of architecture and building products, with more than 400 jurors and hundreds of thousands of public votes helping to recognize the world’s best architecture each year.

Architizer also powers firm directories for a number of AIA (American Institute of Architects) Chapters nationwide, including the official directory of architecture firms for AIA New York.

An example of a project page on Architizer with Project Award Badges highlighted

A Guide to Project Awards

The blue “+” badge denotes that a project has won a prestigious A+Award as described above. Hovering over the badge reveals details of the award, including award category, year, and whether the project won the jury or popular choice award.

The orange Project of the Day and yellow Featured Project badges are awarded by Architizer’s Editorial team, and are selected based on a number of factors. The following factors increase a project’s likelihood of being featured or awarded Project of the Day status:

  • Project completed within the last 3 years
  • A well written, concise project description of at least 3 paragraphs
  • Architectural design with a high level of both functional and aesthetic value
  • High quality, in focus photographs
  • At least 8 photographs of both the interior and exterior of the building
  • Inclusion of architectural drawings and renderings
  • Inclusion of construction photographs

There are 7 Projects of the Day each week and a further 31 Featured Projects. Each Project of the Day is published on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram Stories, while each Featured Project is published on Facebook. Each Project of the Day also features in Architizer’s Weekly Projects Newsletter and shared with 170,000 subscribers.

We’re constantly look for the world’s best architects to join our community. If you would like to understand more about this ranking list and learn how your firm can achieve a presence on it, please don’t hesitate to reach out to us at editorial@architizer.com.
